Header: Bringing in the right balance seems to be the key: Colombo Stock Exchange CEO
Content: The annual summit of the Students Association of Finance and Accounting attached to the Department of Commerce and Financial Management of the University of Kelaniya was held recently. CEO of the Colombo Stock Exchange, Rajeeva Bandaranaike speaking at the event stated: We see that implementations of the principles of good governance in a country could be a futile attempt. And now over the last 20 years or so , corporate governance practices have gained increased attention mainly due to the questionable business practices and corporate scandals that have taken place globally. He added: Sri Lanka Corporate Governance Reforms were introduced through the introduction of courts. Best practices of corporate governance is to advocate corporate governance perspectives such as the improvement of accountability , integrity, efficiency and transparency that the companies should follow to ensure their sustainability. He further stated: So. we all agree on the virtue and importance of imposing stringent corporate governance rules. But if one reflects on the Sri lankan context, given our current status of our corporate culture, bringing in the right balance seems to be the key.
